{
  "article_text": [
    "layered superconductors have an amazingly rich phase diagram in tilted magnetic field .",
    "point ( or `` pancake '' ) vortices generated by the c - axis component of the magnetic field @xcite can form a vast variety of lattice structures .",
    "possible structures include the kinked lattice , @xcite , tilted vortex chains @xcite , coexisting lattices with different orientation@xcite and crossing lattices composed of sublattices of josephson vortices ( jvs ) and pancake - vortex stacks@xcite .",
    "the main source of such richness is the existence of two very different kinds of interactions between the pancake vortices in different layers : magnetic and josephson interactions .",
    "the key parameter , which determines the relative strength of these two interactions and plays a major role in selecting the lattice structures , is the ratio of the two fundamental lengths , the in - plane london penetration depth , @xmath11 , and josephson length @xmath12 , with @xmath13 being the anisotropy parameter and @xmath14 being the interlayer spacing , @xmath15 .",
    "one can distinguish two limiting cases which we refer to as `` extremely anisotropic '' case , @xmath16 , and `` moderately anisotropic '' case @xmath17 . among known atomically layered superconductors",
    ", only bi@xmath18sr@xmath18cacu@xmath18o@xmath19 ( bscco ) and related compounds may belong to the `` extremely anisotropic '' family . even in this compound",
    "the parameter @xmath3 is not smaller than @xmath20 and increases with temperature so that bscco typically becomes `` moderately anisotropic '' in the vicinity of the transition temperature .        at very small c - axis fields ( up to 1 - 2 g )",
    "the pancake stacks in layered superconductors within a wide range of anisotropies are arranged in chains .",
    "an isolated chain is a two - dimensional array of pancake vortices oriented perpendicular to the layers , see fig .",
    "[ fig - crosstiltchain ] . at somewhat higher fields the chains",
    "are surrounded by the regions of regular vortex lattice@xcite .",
    "the internal structure of an isolated chain depends on the ratio @xmath3 and it is relatively simple in two limiting cases . at large @xmath3",
    "the chain is composed of tilted pancake stacks ( tilted chain , right picture in fig.[fig - crosstiltchain ] ) and at small @xmath3 it consists of crossing arrays of jvs and pancake stacks ( crossing chains , left picture in fig.[fig - crosstiltchain ] ) . in this paper we address the highly nontrivial problem of how one structure transforms into another in the region of intermediate @xmath3 .",
    "we analytically and numerically computed ground state configurations in the isolated vortex chain and found two types of phase transitions .",
    "the first phase transition typically takes place for the intermediate separations between pancake stacks @xmath6 , @xmath7\\lambda _",
    "{ j}$ ] , and rather wide range of the ratio @xmath3 , @xmath21 .",
    "the ground state is given by the crossing chain in a wide range of pancake separations @xmath6 .",
    "due to attraction between deformed pancake stacks @xcite , the equilibrium separation can not exceed some maximum value , which depends on the in - plane field and @xmath3 and it is typically of the order of several @xmath22 . with decrease of the pancake separation @xmath6 , the crossing chain becomes strongly deformed and smoothly transforms into the modulated tilted vortices .",
    "the modulation vanishes at a second - order phase transition at which the system transforms into the tilted - chain state .",
    "this phase transition provides possible interpretation of the recent lorentz - microscopy experiment @xcite at which it was observed that the pancake stacks located in the chains smear along the chain direction while the pancake stacks outside chains remain well defined",
    ". this smearing may indicate transition into the tilted - chain state .",
    "another phase transition occurs at very small densities of pancake vortices , @xmath23 , and only when @xmath3 exceeds a certain critical value @xmath24 ( exact criterion depends on the in - plane magnetic field ) . in this case",
    "a small c - axis field penetrates in the form of kinks .",
    "the kinked vortex lines forming tilted chains are composed of jv pieces separated by kinks@xcite .",
    "if the kink energy is only slightly smaller then the energy per pancake in a straight pancake stack then at very small concentration of kinks , typically at @xmath25\\lambda_{j}$ ] , the kinked chains are replaced with strongly deformed crossing chains via a first - order phase transition . due to the opposite signs of interactions ( kinks repel and deformed pancake stacks attract each other )",
    "this transition is accompanied by a very large jump in the pancake density . with further decrease of the pancake separation the chain",
    "smoothly transforms back to the tilted chain as it was described in the previous paragraph .",
    "we constructed the chain phase diagrams for different ratios @xmath3 .",
    "as follows from the above description , there are two types of phase diagrams in the region of intermediate @xmath3 s :    * in the range @xmath26 a small @xmath27-axis field first penetrates in the form of pancake - stack chains located on jvs . due to attractive coupling between the deformed stacks , their density jumps from zero to a finite value . with further increase of the @xmath27 axis field",
    "the chain goes through intermediate strongly deformed configurations and smoothly transforms into a tilted chain ; * in the range @xmath28 small @xmath27-axis field first penetrates in the form of kinks creating kinked tilted vortices . with increase of a @xmath27 axis field this structure",
    "is replaced via the first - order phase transition with the strongly - deformed crossing chains .",
    "this transition is accompanied by a large jump of pancake density .",
    "further evolution of the chain structure is identical to the smaller-@xmath3 scenario : the structure smoothly transforms back into the tilted - chain state .",
    "the exact transition between the two types of behavior depends also on in - plane field .",
    "larger in - plane field favors the first scenario .",
    "the second scenario provides a natural interpretation to recent scanning - hall - probe observations@xcite .",
    "it was observed that at very small concentration of pancakes the chains are magnetically homogeneous and separate pancake stacks are not resolved .",
    "when the external field exceeds some critical value of the order of several oersted , crystallites of the pancake stacks are suddenly formed along the chain and the flux density in the crystallites is much higher then the flux density in the homogeneous chains .",
    "our calculations provide consistent interpretation for these observations .",
    "the magnetically homogeneous chains are interpreted as kinked / tilted chains ( such interpretation has been proposed by dodgson@xcite ) and formation of crystallites can be attributed to the low - density [ kinked lines]-[crossing chains ] first - order phase transition with density jump .    the paper is organized as follows . in section [ sec - general ]",
    "we consider the chain energy functional . in section [ sec - analyt ]",
    "we present analytical estimates for the chain energy in the two limiting cases , crossing and tilted chain , and discuss location of transitional region between these states .",
    "in section [ sec - attrac ] we review attractive interaction between deformed pancake stacks located on jvs .",
    "section [ sec - numerical ] contains the results on numerical exploration of the the phase diagram .",
    "we discuss two different phase transitions between the tilted and crossing chains and two types of phase diagrams which are realized in the region of intermediate parameter @xmath3 .",
    "in this paper we focus on the structure of an isolated vortex chain with period @xmath6 in @xmath29 direction and period @xmath30 in @xmath31 direction where @xmath32 is the number of layers per vertical chain period ( see figure [ fig - crosstiltchain ] ) .",
    "this corresponds to the tilting angle @xmath33 of the magnetic induction with respect to the @xmath27 axis with @xmath34 .",
    "the pancake separation @xmath6 is determined by the c - axis field @xmath35 .",
    "note that we consider the region of very small @xmath35 ( 0.1 - 5 g ) , where it is typically much smaller than external field . the vertical period @xmath27 is fixed by the in - plane field @xmath36 , @xmath37 . for bscco ( @xmath38 ) this period is approximately equal to @xmath39 layers at @xmath40 g .",
    "the chains are separated by distance @xmath41 , @xmath42 .",
    "our calculations are based on the lawrence - doniach free - energy functional in the london approximation , @xmath43 , ( see , e.g. , ref .  ) .",
    "the chain structure is mainly determined by pancake displacements from aligned positions @xmath44 and regular phase distribution @xmath45 .",
    "we consider the case @xmath46 and in - plane distances much smaller than @xmath47 .",
    "in this situation the general lawrence - doniach energy , @xmath48 , can be significantly simplified using several approximations : ( i)we neglect screening of regular phase and @xmath31-axis vector - potential ; ( ii)we subtract the energy of straight pancake stacks , @xmath49 , allowing us to eliminate logarithmically diverging pancake - core contributions ; ( iii)we drop the trivial magnetic energy term @xmath50 which plays no role in selection between different chain phases",
    ". we will use the chain energy per unit area lattice , @xmath51 $ ] with @xmath52 being the total system volume . with the above assumptions the chain energy functional",
    "can be represented as @xmath53   \\nonumber\\\\ &   + \\frac{1}{2}\\frac{n}{n_{tot}}\\sum_{n\\neq m}u_{mr}(u_{n}-u_{m},n - m)\\label{chainen}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the phase stiffness , @xmath54 , and the josephson coupling energy , @xmath55 , are given by @xmath56 @xmath11 and @xmath47 are the components of the london penetration depth and @xmath57 .",
    "the ratio of the two energy scales determines the most important length scale of the problem , the josephson length , @xmath58 .",
    "@xmath59 is the vortex phase variation induced by displacement of pancake rows , @xmath60 , from the ideally aligned positions @xmath61 the discrete gradient @xmath62 is defined as @xmath63 .",
    "@xmath64 is the interaction energy between the pancake rows per unit length , computed with respect to straight stacks @xmath65 , \\ ] ] where @xmath66 is the magnetic interaction between pancakes@xcite@xmath67 + \\frac{s}{4\\lambda}u\\left ( \\frac{r}{\\lambda},\\frac{s|n|}{\\lambda}\\right ) \\right ] \\label{maginter}\\\\ u\\left (   r , z\\right )    &   \\equiv\\exp(-z)e_{1}\\left (   r - z\\right ) + \\exp ( z)e_{1}\\left (   r+z\\right )   , \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] @xmath68 is the integral exponent , @xmath69 , and @xmath70 is a cutoff length ; @xmath71 is the total number of layers .",
    "the energy ( [ chainen ] ) contains contribution coming from a long - range suppression of the josephson energy accumulated from distances @xmath72 , that is identical in all chain phases , @xmath73 .",
    "it is convenient to separate this term and define the local chain energy , @xmath74 , @xmath75 this part of energy weakly depends on @xmath76 and does not diverge for @xmath77 .",
    "we numerically minimized the energy functional ( [ chainen ] ) with respect to @xmath44 and @xmath45 within unit cell , @xmath78 , @xmath79 , and @xmath80 using appropriate symmetry and periodic boundary conditions . in calculation of magnetic coupling energy one",
    "has to take into account periodic conditions for pancake displacements , @xmath81 . in addition , if one selects @xmath31 axis origin at the center of the jv then symmetry also requires @xmath82 .",
    "two simple limiting cases in fig.[fig - crosstiltchain ] correspond to ( i ) @xmath83 for the crossing chain and ( ii ) @xmath84 for the tilted chain .",
    "analytic estimates for energy contributions are possible in two limiting cases of weakly deformed crossing chain and tilted chain shown at fig.[fig - crosstiltchain ] . in this section",
    "we summarize results for chain energies in different limits .",
    "detailed derivations will be published elsewhere .",
    "local energy of crossing chain per unit area is given by @xmath85 here the first term represents the local jv energy , @xmath86 , and the second term is the contribution from the crossing energies of jvs and pancake stacks@xcite .",
    "the local tilted - chain energy per unit area in the limit @xmath87 is given by @xmath88 , \\label{e_tvsm_local}%\\ ] ] @xmath89 with @xmath90 being the euler constant .",
    "in eq.([e_tvsm_local ] ) the first term represents the loss of the magnetic coupling energy in the tilted chain and the second term represents the josephson energy loss .    in the region of kinked lines @xmath91 ( but @xmath92 ) , the local chain energy is given by @xmath93 .",
    "\\label{e_tvresult_lrg}%\\ ] ] in this equation @xmath86 is the local jv - lattice energy , the first term in square brackets gives the single - kink energy and the third term gives the kink interaction energy .    to find out whether the crossing or tilted chain is realized for given values of parameters @xmath6 , @xmath27 , and @xmath3 , we have to compare the energies of these states .",
    "comparison of eqs .",
    "( [ encrosschain_loc ] ) and ( [ e_tvsm_local ] ) gives transitional pancake separation @xmath94 which decreases with @xmath95 and increases with @xmath3 @xcite .",
    "naively , one may think that intersection of the energy curves for two states would correspond to a first - order phase transition between these states .",
    "however , as we will see from numerical simulations , in the region @xmath96 another scenario is realized .",
    "typically , strongly deformed intermediate chain configurations develop in the transitional region providing a smooth transformation between the two limiting configurations .",
    "therefore , a simple energy comparison gives only an approximate location of the transitional region separating the two configurations .    in the region",
    "@xmath97 and @xmath98 comparison of the energies ( [ encrosschain_loc ] ) and ( [ e_tvresult_lrg ] ) gives the following equation @xmath99 this equation has a solution only in the kink penetration regime , @xmath100 , where the kink energy is only slightly smaller that the energy per pancake of a straight pancake - vortex stack .",
    "in contrast to the case @xmath101 , this equation does correspond to a very strong first - order phase transition .",
    "a peculiar property of the crossing chain is an attractive interaction between the deformed pancake stacks at large distances@xcite . as a consequence , when the magnetic field is tilted from the direction of layers the density of pancake stacks located on jvs jumps from zero to a finite value",
    "this means the existence of a maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 between pancake stacks , i.e. , chains with @xmath103 are not realized in equilibrium .",
    "note that the tilted vortices also attract each other within some range of angles and distances @xcite meaning that tilted chains also have this property in some range of parameters .",
    "simple analytical formula for the attraction energy between the deformed pancake stacks can be derived for very anisotropic superconductors @xmath104 in the range @xmath105 @xcite . in this",
    "limit short - range pancake displacements @xmath60 from the aligned positions in two neighboring stacks produce dipole - like contribution to interaction energy per unit length between these stacks @xmath106 this term has to be combined with the usual repulsive interaction between straight stacks @xmath107 .",
    "minimum of the total interaction energy , @xmath108 gives an estimate for the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 @xcite , @xmath109 and this result is valid until @xmath110 . because in bscco @xmath22 is only @xmath111 times larger than @xmath112 , this simple formula is not practical for this compound .",
    "we will see that @xmath102 in bscco is usually larger than @xmath22 .",
    "in general , the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 is determined by the minimum of the pancake part of energy per one stack @xmath113 .",
    "when the main contribution to the total interaction energy is coming from the nearest - neighbor interaction , @xmath102 coincides with the position of the minimum in the pair interaction potential .",
    "we explored the chain structures by numerically minimizing ( [ chainen ] ) with respect to the pancake row displacement @xmath60 and regular phase distribution @xmath114 for different values of the parameters @xmath6 , @xmath115 , and @xmath3 . in the following sections we review the results of these calculations .",
    "we studied the evolution of chain structures with decreasing pancake separation @xmath6 at fixed @xmath3 and @xmath95 . for small values of @xmath3",
    "we found that the chain structure smoothly evolves with decreasing @xmath6 from crossing to tilted configuration .",
    "an example of such evolution is presented in fig.[fig - nl7al0_4 ] for @xmath116 and @xmath117 .",
    "the upper plot shows the dependence of the maximum pancake displacement from the straight - stack position @xmath118 ( defined in the inset ) on the pancake separation @xmath6 .",
    "we will use this parameter to characterize the chain structure throughout the paper .",
    "it changes from zero for straight stacks to @xmath119 for tilted chains .",
    "the lower plot shows the @xmath6 dependence of the reduced pancake energy per unit cell , @xmath120 , which is used to determine the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath121 . at large @xmath6 a weakly deformed crossing configuration",
    "is realized ( see structure at @xmath122 ) . with decrease of @xmath6",
    "the chain evolves into strongly corrugated configurations such as configuration for @xmath123 in fig .",
    "[ fig - nl7al0_4 ] . with further decrease of @xmath6 this structure",
    "smoothly transforms into modulated tilted lines ( see structure for @xmath124 ) .",
    "finally , the last structure transforms via a second - order phase transition into the straight tilted lines . for parameters used in fig.[fig - nl7al0_4 ]",
    "this occurs at @xmath125 .",
    "the plateau in the dependence @xmath126 below this value of @xmath6 corresponds the maximum possible relative displacement @xmath127 in the tilted chain .     for @xmath116 and @xmath117 .",
    "_ lower plot _ shows dependence of the pancake energy per unit cell @xmath128 ( in units of phase stiffness @xmath54 ) on pancake separation .",
    "its minimum determines the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath121 .",
    "representative chain structures are shown for several values of @xmath6(boxes show positions of the pancake vortices and horizontal lines mark jvs ) .",
    "one can see that the system evolves from weakly deformed chain ( @xmath122 ) via strongly deformed chain ( @xmath129 ) to modulated tilted chain ( @xmath130 ) .",
    "the last structure transforms via a 2nd - order phase transition at @xmath131 into tilted straight vortices.,width=432 ]    comparison of numerical and analytical calculations shows that the analytical estimates ( [ encrosschain_loc ] ) and ( [ e_tvsm_local ] ) accurately reproduce numerical results for the weakly deformed crossing chain and for the tilted chain .",
    "however , the numerical study predicts intermediate configurations with energies smaller than the energies of the both limiting configurations . as a result ,",
    "a naively expected first - order phase transition is replaced by a continuous transition occurring at significantly smaller @xmath6 .",
    "the transitional region just marks the location of the intermediate strongly deformed chain configurations . the observed continuous phase transition is related to the instability of isolated tilted vortices in anisotropic superconductors@xcite .     for the ratio @xmath117 .",
    "thick line with open circles indicates phase transition into the tilted chain .",
    "thin line shows the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 . ]    in fig .",
    "[ fig - phasdiagal04 ] we present the chain phase diagrams in the @xmath6-@xmath95-plane for @xmath117 .",
    "the thick line shows the phase transition into the tilted - chain state .",
    "one can see that at larger @xmath95 the transition takes place at smaller @xmath6 .",
    "with increase of @xmath3 this line moves higher .",
    "dotted lines show locations of the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 discussed in sec .",
    "[ sec - attrac ] .",
    "we see that @xmath132 line crosses the transition line meaning that at small @xmath95 @xmath102 falls into the tilted - chain region and at large @xmath95 it falls into the crossing - chain region .",
    "the obtained phase diagram implies that at small tilting angle of the field ( corresponding to small @xmath6 ) the tilted chains have lower energy than the crossing chains .",
    "this is similar to the situation at higher fields , in the dense lattice , where the crossing - lattices state also is expected to transform into the simple tilted lattice at small tilting angle of the field@xcite .      at higher values of the ratio @xmath3 a new qualitative feature appears in the phase diagram .",
    "when @xmath3 exceeds the critical value , the @xmath27 axis field initially penetrates in the form of kinks forming kinked vortex lines ( lock - in transition@xcite ) .",
    "the critical value of @xmath3 is determined by combination of numerical constants in the pancake - stack and kink energies . at present ,",
    "our best estimate for this constant is @xmath134 . the critical value of @xmath3 increases with decrease of @xmath95 , due to the increasing relative contribution of the crossing energies in the energy of crossing chain .",
    "a very peculiar behavior is expected when @xmath3 only slightly exceeds @xmath135 .",
    "the competing chain states have very different interactions : deformed stacks attract and kinks repel each other .",
    "moreover , at the same value of the c - axis magnetic induction , @xmath136 , the kinks are much closer than the stacks and the absolute value of the kink interaction energy is much larger than the interaction energy between deformed stacks .",
    "as a consequence , with increase of @xmath136 the total energy of the kinked lines rapidly exceeds the total energy of the crossing chain and the system experiences a first - order phase transition into the crossing - chain state . due to the attractive interaction between the pancake stacks",
    ", the pancake / kink separation at which the energy curves cross does not give the equilibrium separation for the crossing chain and the stack separation jumps at the transition to a value slightly smaller than the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 .",
    "this means that the phase transition is accompanied by jumps of the pancake density and magnetic induction , @xmath136 .     for @xmath137 and @xmath138 .",
    "the two branches at low @xmath139 correspond to two different starting states , kinked lines ( 1 ) and crossing chain ( 2 ) .",
    "the kinked lines have lower energy at very small @xmath139 , at @xmath140 .",
    "crossing chain smoothly transforms back into tilted chain with increase of @xmath139 .",
    "the transformation is completed at the second - order phase transition point near @xmath141 .",
    "chain configurations are shown at four marked points .",
    ", width=412 ]    this behavior was confirmed by numerical calculations .",
    "figure [ fig - aden16al0_6 ] shows a plot of the dependence of the energy per chain unit cell @xmath142 on the pancake density @xmath143 for @xmath137 and @xmath138 .",
    "this dependence has two branches , corresponding to two different starting states at small @xmath139 , crossing chain and kinked lines , and the kinked vortex lines have smaller energy at smaller @xmath139 .",
    "the branches cross at @xmath144 marking the first - order transition .",
    "the variations of @xmath142 at small @xmath139 occur due to the interaction energy and one can see that the kink interaction energy is much larger than the crossing - chain interaction energy",
    ". with further increase of @xmath139 , the crossing chain smoothly transforms into the tilted chain following the scenario described in the previous section .",
    "the second - order phase transition for these parameters takes place at @xmath145 corresponding to @xmath146 .",
    "the latter value is somewhat smaller than the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath147 .",
    "( in units of @xmath148 ) at different values of chemical potential @xmath149 corresponding to different external fields for @xmath116 and @xmath138 .",
    "kinks in the curves separate regions of tilted / kinked lines ( low @xmath139 ) and crossing chains ( high @xmath139 ) .",
    "the equilibrium density is given by the global minimum of this energy .",
    "one can see that at @xmath150 the system experiences a first - order phase transition with very large density jump .",
    "_ right plot _ shows the corresponding dependencies of the average magnetic induction , @xmath35 , ( left axis ) and the maximum induction in the middle of the chain , @xmath151 , ( right axis ) vs the magnetic field strength , @xmath152.,width=374 ]    -@xmath6 plane for @xmath138 . _ the right panel",
    "_ illustrates definitions of the phase lines using the plot of the thermodynamic potential @xmath153 vs @xmath154 at the transition point .",
    "the lines @xmath155 and @xmath156 correspond to the two limiting pancake separations at the transition point between which the jump occurs .",
    "the line 2 indicates crossing of the energy curves for the kinked and crossing chain .",
    "the line @xmath157 shows position of the continuous transition into the tilted chain .",
    "dotted line slightly above @xmath156-line shows position of the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 .",
    "we also show by the dashed line the crossover line @xmath158 above which well - defined kinks appear . ]",
    "the pancake density in the chain can not be directly fixed in experiment . instead",
    ", the magnetic field strength , @xmath152 , fixes the chemical potential @xmath159 , @xmath160 , and the equilibrium density is determined by the global minimum of the thermodynamic potential @xmath161 . to find the density evolution with increasing the chemical potential , we plot in fig.[fig - de - munn16al0_6](left ) the density dependencies of the reduced thermodynamic potential , @xmath162 for different @xmath149 and representative parameters @xmath116 and @xmath138 . as the energy of isolated stacks",
    "is subtracted in @xmath163 , the dimensionless chemical potential is shifted with respect to its bare value and it is related to the magnetic field strength as @xmath164 , where @xmath165 is the lower critical field for @xmath166 .",
    "we find that for selected parameters the transition takes place at @xmath167 . at @xmath168",
    "the global minimum falls into the region of kinked lines and at @xmath169 it jumps into the region of crossing chain .",
    "note that the density value , at which the energy curves cross ( kinks in the lines in fig .",
    "[ fig - de - munn16al0_6 ] ) , is always larger than the lower density from which the jump to the high - density state takes place . at the transition ,",
    "the density jumps almost ten times , from @xmath170 to @xmath171 .",
    "the right plot in fig.[fig - de - munn16al0_6 ] shows the corresponding dependencies of the average magnetic induction , @xmath172 , ( left axis ) and the maximum induction in the middle of the chain , @xmath173 , ( right axis ) vs the magnetic field strength , @xmath152 .",
    "one can see that the jump in @xmath35 occurs from @xmath174 g to @xmath175 g .",
    "the numerically obtained phase diagram in the @xmath95-@xmath6 plane for @xmath138 is shown in the left panel of fig.[fig - phasediagal0_6 ] .",
    "the plot of the thermodynamic potential at the transition point in the left panel illustrates definitions of different lines in the phase diagram .",
    "the lines @xmath155 and @xmath156 show the limiting pancake separations at the first - order transition between which the jump takes place . when the chemical potential is fixed by external conditions the area between these lines is bypassed in equilibrium . the line @xmath176 inside this region marks the crossing of the energy curves for the two states . at large",
    "@xmath95 the jump takes place from the kinked - lines state into the strongly corrugated configuration .",
    "this configuration transforms into the tilted chain with further decrease of @xmath6 via continuous transition shown by the line @xmath157 .",
    "below @xmath116 only tilted chains realize , but the density jump still exists .",
    "the upper separation grows approximately proportional to @xmath95 while the lower separation slowly decreases with @xmath95 and lies slightly below the maximum equilibrium separation @xmath102 shown by a dotted line .",
    "this means that the relative density jump increases with @xmath95 .",
    "this type of phase diagram exists within a finite range of @xmath3 , roughly @xmath177 . at larger @xmath3 s",
    "only tilted chains exist .",
    "in conclusion , we investigated the phase diagram of an isolated vortex chain in layered superconductors . in the region where josephson and magnetic coupling are approximately equal , we found a very rich behavior .",
    "the crossing chains typically transform into the tilted chains with decreasing pancake separation via formation of intermediate strongly deformed configurations and continuous phase transition .",
    "when the relative strength of the josephson coupling exceeds some typical value , the phase diagram becomes reentrant . at very small c - axis field ,",
    "tilted chains are realized in which the vortex lines have kinked structure . with increasing the c - axis field",
    "these low - density tilted chains transform via a first - order phase transition into the strongly - deformed crossing chains .",
    "this transition is accompanied by a large jump of pancake - vortex density . with further field increase these crossing chains",
    "transform back into the tilted chains via a second - order transition .",
    "i would like to thank m.  dodgson , a.  grigorenko , s.  bending , and v.  vlasko - vlasov for useful discussions and the referee a for improving presentation .",
    "i also gratefully acknowledge use of `` jazz '' , a 350-node computing cluster operated by the mathematics and computer science division at argonne national laboratory as part of its laboratory computing resource center .",
    "this work was supported by the u.  s.  doe , office of science , under contract # w-31 - 109-eng-38 .",
    "a.  i.  buzdin and a.  yu .  simonov , jetp lett .  * 51 * , 191 ( 1990 ) ; a.  m.  grishin , a.  y.martynovich , and s.  v.  yampolskii , sov .",
    "jetp * 70 * , 1089 ( 1990 ) ; b.  i.  ivlev and n.  b.  kopnin , phys.rev .",
    "b * 44 * , 2747 ( 1991 ) ; w.  a.  m.  morgado , m.  m.doria , and g.  carneiro , physica c , * 349 * , 196 ( 2001 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in the presence of the josephson vortex lattice in layered superconductors , a small c - axis magnetic field penetrates in the form of vortex chains . in general , </S>",
    "<S> the structure of a single chain is determined by the ratio of the london [ @xmath0 and josephson [ @xmath1 lengths , @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> the chain is composed of tilted vortices at large @xmath3 s ( tilted chain ) and at small @xmath3 s it consists of a crossing array of josephson vortices and pancake - vortex stacks ( crossing chain ) . </S>",
    "<S> we study chain structures at intermediate @xmath3 s and found two types of phase transitions . </S>",
    "<S> for @xmath4 the ground state is given by the crossing chain in a wide range of pancake separations @xmath5\\lambda_j$ ] . </S>",
    "<S> however , due to attractive coupling between deformed pancake stacks , the equilibrium separation can not exceed some maximum value depending on the in - plane field and @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> the first phase transition takes place with decreasing pancake - stack separation @xmath6 at @xmath7\\lambda _ </S>",
    "<S> { j}$ ] , and rather wide range of the ratio @xmath3 , @xmath8 . with decreasing @xmath6 </S>",
    "<S> , the crossing chain goes through intermediate strongly - deformed configurations and smoothly transforms into a tilted chain via a second - order phase transition . </S>",
    "<S> another phase transition occurs at very small densities of pancake vortices , @xmath9\\lambda_j$ ] , and only when @xmath3 exceeds a certain critical value @xmath10 . in this case </S>",
    "<S> a small c - axis field penetrates in the form of kinks . </S>",
    "<S> however , at very small concentration of kinks , the kinked chains are replaced with strongly deformed crossing chains via a first - order phase transition . </S>",
    "<S> this transition is accompanied by a very large jump in the pancake density .    </S>",
    "<S> pacs numbers : 74.25.qt , 74.25.op , 74.20.de </S>"
  ]
}
